intro: Ephippium masdevalliaceum, commonly known as the golden thread plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbelliferous plants, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal. Ephippium masdevalliaceum is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal environments with salt spray exposure.
